author: Special Correspondent
text:
A para motor team, “Skyriders”, of the Indian Air Force, which has embarked on an expedition “Pradakshina”, arrived at the Thanjavur Air Force Station on Friday.

The team has embarked on the adventure of flying around the country traversing more than 10,000 km on paramotors.

The expedition was flagged off at Air Force Station, Gurgaon, New Delhi, on January 28.

The team comprises 14 Air Warriors of the IAF including paramotor pilots, ground vehicles and supporting staff led by Wing Commander M.P.S. Solanki from the Directorate of Adventure, Indian Air Force , according to a release.

Paramotor flying includes open cockpit flying where the pilot was not protected and was exposed to the weather.

The team would brave hostile weather conditions and cross different terrains, coasts, forests and deserts, the release added.

On their arrival at Thanjavur, the team was received by Group Captain R.V.Shinde, Station Commander, Air Force Station, Thanjavur.
title: ‘Skyriders’ reaches Thanjavur
